name: Printmaking & Its Masters
description: From ancient woodcuts to modern lithographs, journey through the evocative world of printmaking and its pioneers.

flashcards.question: Which printmaking technique involves carving into a block of wood?
Which artist is known for his series 'Thirty-Six Views of Mount Fuji'?
In which printmaking process is an image etched into a metal plate using acid?
Which German Renaissance artist is renowned for his woodcuts and engravings?
What is the name of the printmaking technique that uses a flat stone or metal plate?
Which printmaking method involves cutting away areas from a soft sheet, leaving raised areas to receive ink?
Which 20th-century artist is known for his color linocuts, especially of the South of France?
In which country did Ukiyo-e, a genre of woodblock prints, originate?
Which printmaking technique involves cutting into the surface of a metal plate with a burin?
Aquatint, a variant of etching, is used to achieve what effect in printmaking?
